item.title: Simplex
item.description:
An In-Depth Overview of the Simplex Method

Abstract

This document presents an in-depth exposition of the simplex method for solving linear programs. We discuss fundamental concepts such as basic feasible solutions (BFS), the notion of adjacency between extreme points, and the nondegeneracy assumption. Both the primal and the dual simplex methods are described from a matrixâ€“theoretic viewpoint with illustrative examples. Finally, we present a worst-case efficiency analysis under a basic value distribution assumption.
